result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Lee Rice was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
With Huber and Good Time Credit.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with Ashley Taggert and/or Monica Hooper. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, through e-mail or text message or through a third party. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 11:47 am case called. Defendant Richard Lee Rice in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and read into record.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1 & Count 2.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads in Counts 3 & 4. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: COUNT 1-10 months WCJ with Huber and Good Time Credit. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. To begin no later than October 1, 2014. Credit for 3 days served. COUNT 2-SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through, the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No Contact with Ashley Taggert and/or Monica Hooper. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Drug Buy Reimbursement amount of $500. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 29, 2014 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on August 21, 2014 at 01:35 pm.

Case called @ 2:15 p.m. Defendant Richard Lee Rice in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Defendant Richard Lee Rice in custody.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed. Receipt admitted - reading waived.  NGP entered.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 01:35 pm.
Initial appearance on August 4, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant is prohibited from going on the premises of any bars.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is not to serve as a supervisor or caretaker of any children under the age of 16 years.

Case Called @ 1:40 PM: Defendant Richard Lee Rice in court, in custody, with attorney Bryan D. Keberlein, both appearing via video.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Per SPD, eligibility confirmed.  Counsel confirm PO Hold.  DA argues for Signature Bond.  SPD argues as to bond - no objection to bond requested.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
Return of Search Warrant, Search Warrant, Application for Search Warrant and Items Seized - Property located at N2389 18th Ave, Town of Dakota, Waushara Co, WI
